pros: got to be around people a lot. a good paying job for a teenager. Good professional experience.
cons: they did not work with my schedule very well.

pros:
Lots of over time if you want it.
Pay is comparative to other areas.
Small discounts on food/drinks/gift shop and can pay with ID card.
Fast paced environment.
Great co-workers.
Good benefits on educational assistance.
cons: It's not for everyone and there are always going to be mean or lazy people. Everywhere you go there is going to be something you don't like but the only thing I didn't like was at first there was one nurse who was tough on me. After awhile she came around and we ended up really enjoying each other, most of the time. I guess the only other thing would be could have gotten a better discount on the food but that's being picky. Well I would have to stay our supply room never seemed to be stocked the right way so it looked like we were stocked and really we weren't.

review_title: Very very disappointed in an organization CLAIMING to be a CHARITABLE CATHOLIC INSTITUTION.
pros: The people that work at Provena not including management or administration.  The profession i chose but could do the same elsewhere.
cons: Negative, hostile environment created from administration, down the chain of command to management and employees.  Unfair compensation.  Only caring about the bottom line not about the work that is done of the lives it impacts.  They would rather look good then provide an excellent service.  Administration would rather cut back on employees than give up a small percentage of thier salary.

review_title: Sorry place to work, but great place to heal.
pros: If you live in the area it is a major employer. If you are interested in health care in general, it is state of the art.
cons: Management has ZERO connection to the "little people." Recent new upper level management has lost sight of "Christ" in its Christian  roots (St. Joseph). The hourly staff has been doubled up with work, and stripped of many little things (like packets of sugar, paper cups, coffee and botteled water), all in the name of cutting costs. And yet, it was my undestanding that technology is getting millions of $ in upgrades. Lots of inside networking keeping information from the "little people." Lots of pressure to produce, smile, etc. Meetings abound, but for nothing.

review_title: Provena St Joseph Hospital is a clean, comfortable, well supplied place to practice Nursing
job_title: RN On MedSurg Floor in Joliet, IL
pros: Most units recently remodeled or new, I usually have the support and supplies I need to safely and effectively perform my job of patient care and safety. The Nurses belong to a union in our hospital, so we have some benefits and support that other non-union workplaces don't. I enjoy going to work every day
cons: I am hoping the recent merger will lower health insurance costs, and recent staffing shortages have been a souce of stress. At times the patient load is more than I would like, but newly hired RN's are in training, and staffing issues are a common porblem in hospital nursing.

job_title: Patient Access Representative II in Danville, IL
pros: I am a people person. I enjoyed working around people. I worked 3rd shift ER the last 18 months of my employment. I really loved my job and 3rd shift!
cons: Upfront collections is their #1 concern. It's not about the patients. No raise if haven't met collection monthly goal. Resurrection took away employee activities, company picnics, $1 tickets to use in the café or gift shop. More was added to your job but no incentives given.

review_title: Catholic hospital lacks compassion and quality of care
job_title: Insurance Verification Specialist in Evanston, IL
pros: Good benefits, many longstanding dedicated employees
cons: More interested in productivity no matter what the cost to the employee or the quality of care rendered to the patient .  No compassion as stated in their mission.

pros:
Great place to work.
Senior Management is very good and willing to work with you. 
Movement up can be achieved through hard work.
cons: I can not think of any cons of the company.

review_title: Great enviroment for the residents' and reassurance for their families. Staff is under appreciated.
job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Avilla, IN
pros: Great team leader and floor staff.
cons: Administrators don't know how to show appreciation.

pros: Close to live and shorter commute
There are a number of great people in management and many advancement opportunities.
cons: None that I can think of.

pros: Very well equiped, have all the needed materials to perform duties
Good benefits, decent pay, mostly flexible
cons: As with any hospital, staffing is always an issue

pros:
Good Benefits
Good Work/Life Balance
Cares for Employees
Great Company Values
cons: Promotions are competitive otherwise a good company
